title: dbe - data schema for building envelopes
description: This data schema allows to exchange detailed data about building envelopes. For each data point, there is exactly one key in the schema to make it easy to develop software which interprets the data correctly. If you should miss any key, please propose it at the website to be included in the next updata of this schema.

internationalString.description: It has been decided to keep everything in English so far. If other languages are included at a later stage, this structure makes it easy.

items.description: The number for which an uncertainty can be defined in the second objectin this array.

uncertainty.description: The uncertainty of the number of the first object in this array.

reference.description: The reference defines how the uncertainty has been determined.

items.description: The non-negative number for which an uncertainty can be defined in the second objectin this array.

uncertainty.description: The uncertainty of the number of the first object in this array.

reference.description: The reference defines how the uncertainty has been determined.

units.title: This section defines types for numbers with units

meter.description: Meter is the SI unit for length.

meterWithoutUncertainty.description: Meter is the SI unit for length. MeterWithoutUncertainty is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

squareMeter.description: A quare meter is a unit for an area.

cubicMeter.description: A cubic meter is a unit for a volume.

degree.description: A unit to measure angles. A full rotation equals 360Â°.

radian.description: A unit to measure angles. A full rotation equals 2*Pi.

created.description: The date when this data was first stored in the database.

from.description: The earliest date for which the data is valid.

until.description: The lastest date for which the data is valid.

from.description: The earliest date at which it was available.

until.description: The earliest date at which it was available.

contact.title: In this section, you find all contact data for an institution or person.

phone.description: Phone number of an institution or person

address.description: Postal address of an institution or person

email.description: E-mail address of an institution or person

website.description: Website of an institution or person

basicStakeholder.title: A stakeholder can be either an institution or a person. This section collects the basic data of stakeholders.

uri.description: This URI defines the stakeholder which is either an institution or a person.

explanation.description: This explanation can specify the role of the stakeholder.

person.title: This section collects all data about a person.

uri.description: The URI which defines the person

family.description: The family name(s) also known as surname(s) or last name(s) of a person

given.description: The given name(s) also known as forname(s) or first name(s) of a person

uri.description: The URI which defines the affiliation of the person

name.description: The name of the affiliation of the person

institution.title: This sections collects data about an institution.

uri.description: The URI which defines the institution

explanation.description: The explanation can further explain the role of the institution.

publicKey.description: The public key of the institution for cryptography

roles.title: This section collects the definitions of the various roles which an institution or a person can have.

owner.description: The owner holds the rights for example on a component and is defined by an URI.

submitter.description: The submitter submits data to a database and is defined by an URI.

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer manufactures the componente and is defined by an URI.

approver.description: The approver states that data or a method fulfills certain requirements. She is defined by an URI.

admin.description: The admin is in charge of a database and is defined by an URI.

author.description: The author of a publication is defined by an URI.

developer.description: The developer of a method or component is defined by an URI.

creator.description: The creator of a data set is defined by an URI.

standardizer.description: A standardizer is an institution which creates a standard. The institution is defined by an URI.

component.title: This section collects the definitions regarding components of building envelopes

basics.title: This section collects the basic definitions about a component.

explanation.description: An explanation with more details about the component

version.description: The URI defines the version of the component.

categories.description: The component is categorized in order to facilitate queries.

constants.description: There are two types of parameters: constants are defined here and do not change in one data set. Variables may change for each data point. Therefore, variables are stored close to the data points.

owner.description: The URI and description of the owner of the component

manufacturer.description: The URI and description of the manufacturer of the component

developer.description: The URI and description of the institution or person which developed the component

approvals.description: If the dataset for this component has been approved by an institution, this approval is specified here.

available.description: Since when and until when the component has been available

optical.description: All optical data of the data set is stored in this section.

items.description: A building envelope component can be a plain material, a layer in a stack of layers of a unit including frame effects. While some components are used e.g. only as materials, other components can be used in several categories.
Components of the category material can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the material.
Components of the category layer can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the layer.
Components of the category unit can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the unit.

version.title: This section provides definitions about a version of a component.

uri.description: This URI defines a specific version of a component.

name.description: If the version of the component has a specific name or version number, it can be entered here.

explanation.description: Here the version can be described in free text.

owner.description: The URI and description of the owner of the component

manufacturer.description: The URI and description of the manufacturer of the component

developer.description: The URI and description of the institution or person which developed the component

available.description: Since when and until when the component has been available

constants.title: For one dataset, the constants of the component stay the same while the variables may change between different data points.

geometry.title: This section defines the geometry of the component which can either be an assembly or a single component.

airPermeability.description: The air permeability defines how easy air can flow through the component.

colour.description: The reference offers several way to define the colour of the component.

cutOff.description: The cutoff angle is an angle above which the incident radiation cannot cause glare.

chemicalElements.description: In this array, the most important chemical elements can be named by the two letters of the periodic table of elements.

material.description: If the component is a material, the material-specific constants can be named here.

layer.description: If the component is a layer, the layer-specific constants can be named here.

unit.description: If the component is a unit, the unit-specific constants can be named here.

uri.description: This URI identifies the method which is specified below.

explanation.description: Here the method can be described in free text.

structure.description: This section defines the method which may be an assembly of different submethods which are applied on a number of inputs.

categories.title: With this array, it is defined whether the method is a measurement or a calculation only or both.

developer.description: This section defines who developed the method.

reference.description: If the method is an implementation of standard or of a procedure described in a publication, this reference can be defined here.

created.description: This date defines when the method was created.

valid.description: Here you can define since when the method is valid and until when. This can be helpful for example when a regulation or standard changes.

available.description: Here you can define since when the method has been available and until when. This can be helpful for example when a method is shared considerably later than when it was created. You can also use it to define that the method may have been available for a long time even though it may not be valid for the whole time of its availability.

calculation.description: Here you can define the method either as code or as executable.

structure.title: This sections is used to define how the method is structured as an assembly of submethods.

onInputs.description: Each item defines the URI of one method. The first method will be applied to the first input, the second to the second and so forth. An empty URI string defines that no method is applied on the corresponding input.

properties.description: This URI defines the method which is applied after input methods have been applied on the inputs. The output method with this URI generates the results of the method.

calculation.title: This section is used to define how a method can be calculated, either by code or by an executable.

formatting.description: This section defines which format the code has for example a certain version of a programming language.

properties.description: The executable can be downloaded directly from this hostname.

formatting.description: This section defines which format the executable has.

reference.title: This section is used to refer to a standard or a publication.

standard.description: This section defines which standard is refered to.

publication.description: This section defines which publication is refered to.

uri.description: The URI defines this specific publication.

items.description: This array lists all persons which have authored the publication

standard.title: Standards are a special kind publications. Therefore their data structure is different from publications.

uri.description: The URI defines this specific standard.

title.description: The full title of the standard

items.description: Standards typically do not name authors, but an institution or several institutions which created the standard.

identifier.description: A standard may be named `ISO 52022-1` or `ASTM E2387`. While `ISO` and `ASTM` are the abbreviations for the standardizers, `52022` and `2387` are the main numbers. `E` is the prefix and `1` is the postfix which may indicate for example a part number. This classification facilitates the search, because there are multiple ways to refer to a standard.

year.description: It is important to define the year in which the standard was issued because there can be relevant updates of one standard.

standard.description: `ISO 52022` is an example of the abbreviation of a standardizer and the main number of the identifier.

database.description: Information about a database which has implemented the same API specification.

uri.description: The database is identified by its API endpoint.

owner.description: The institution which owns the database

admin.description: The institution which administrates the database

valid.description: For which timespan the data of the database is valid

available.description: For which timespan the database is or was available

internalComment.description: If there are any specific issues with a database, the administrators can use this string.

approvals.title: If the validity of a data is important, this section can be used to express the approval of a institution with a cryptographic signature. It's an array, because there may be approvals of several institutions for the same data.

uri.description: The approval is identified by this URI.

approver.description: The stakeholder who approved the data is identified by its URI.

verify.description: This section defines how the approval can be verified.

signature.description: This string defines the cryptographic signature of the approved data.

valid.description: For which timespan the approval is valid

website.description: The hostname of the website where the approval can be verified.

explanation.description: Explanation how the approval can be verified

possiblePositions.title: The locations where a component can be used

items.description: Exterior of the building envelope, in between of the building envelope for example between to glass panes or interior of the building envelope.

colour.description: This section offers several ways to define the colour of a component

name.description: The name of the colour in natural language

CRI.description: The Colour Rendering Index (CRI) indicates how well for example the transmitted radiation matches daylight.

CIELAB.description: The three parameters L*, a* and b* from CIE define the colour as well as the brightness.

formatting.title: This section is used to define the format of data.

uri.description: The format is identified by this URI.

name.description: The full name of the format

version.description: The version of the format is identified by this URI.

reference.description: If the format is defined in a standard or a publication, this reference can be defined here.

file.title: This section defines the data of a specific file.

uri.description: The file can be downloaded directly from this hostname.

envelope.description: The orientations vertical, parallel and orthogonal refer to the building envelope and the component in its usual mounting position.

properties.description: A cartesian coordinate system is assumed.

origin.description: A cartesian coordinate system is assumed.

tilt.description: For horizontal slats, the slat tilt angle is measured from the horizontal plane. 0Â° means fully open slats and 70Â° almost closed slats.

maximumClosing.description: The maximum closing angle is the highest possible slat tilt angle, typically because the slats tough each other.

polar.description: In the spherical coordinate system, the polar angle is measured from a fixed axis such as the z-axis of a cartesian coordinate system.

azimuth.description: In the spherical coordinate system, the polar angle is measured from orthogonal projextion of the direction on a reference plane such as the plane between the x- and y-axis of a cartestian coordinate system.

xz.description: If the z-axis is normal to the building envelope and the x-axis directs for example vertically upwards in a facade,then the angle xz is measured from the z-axis towards the x-axis. 80Â° is then from the facade almost vertically upwards and -10Â° means from the facade downwards, but almost horizontal.

yz.description: If the z-axis is normal to the building envelope, the x-axis directs for example vertically upwards in a facade and the y-axis is horizontal in an right-handed coordinate system, then the angle yz is measured from the z-axis towards the y axis. From the facade looking to the exterior, 80Â° means a direction far right, almost parallel to the facade. -10Â° means from the facade to exterior slightly left, but almost perpendiculat to the facade.

incidence.description: If the sample has a rotational symmetry, then the incidence angle is sufficient to define the direction.

formatting.description: Definition of the format of the array below

items.description: In order to reduze the size of this data file, the multiple directions can be entered as an array.
